description: This book examines the pattern of occupational change in Western Europe by drawing on extensive evidence of employment data on the pattern of occupational change in Britain, Denmark, Germany, Spain and Switzerland since 1990. It documents the change in the employment structure, and examines the five underlying driving forces--technology, globalization, education, migration and institutions-in order to address the question of how the employment structure hasevolved: towards good jobs, bad jobs or increasing polarization?
title: Occupational Change in Europe
